servinfo.title: Engine Oil and Filter Change

item.ptxt: New and used engine oil can be hazardous.
Be sure to read “WARNING” in General Precautions and observe what is written there.
Steps 1) – 7) below must be performed with ENGINE NOT RUNNING.
For Step 8), be sure to have adequate ventilation while engine is running.

servinfo.ptxt: Before draining engine oil, check engine for oil leakage.
If any sign of leakage is found, make sure to correct defective part before proceeding to the following procedure.

s1.ptxt: Drain engine oil by removing drain plug.
Reinstall new drain plug with new gasket and tighten it to specified torque.
Loosen oil filter (1) using oil filter wrench (special tool).

attention3.ptxt: Before fitting new oil filter, be sure to apply engine to oil its O-ring.

s1.ptxt: Install oil filter (1) using oil filter wrench (special tool).

Replenish oil until oil level is brought to FULL level mark (hole) on oil level gauge (oil pan and oil filter capacity). The filter inlet is at the top of cylinder head cover. It is recommended to use engine oil of SG, SH, SJ, SL or SM grade.
Select the appropriate oil viscosity according to the chart [A].
SAE 5W-30 is the best choice for good fuel economy, and good starting in cold weather.

item.ptxt: Engine oil capacity is specified as follows.
However, note that the amount of oil required when actually changing oil may somewhat differ from the data depending on various conditions (temperature, viscosity, etc.).
The specified engine oil and “proper engine oil viscosity chart [A]” included in this manual are given as typical ones.
The actual engine oil and proper engine oil viscosity, however, vary depending on the vehicle specifications and such typical chart may not be applicable to some models.
Therefore, for the specific information on the engine oil and proper engine oil viscosity, refer to “Engine Oil and Filter” section of the Owner’s Manual.

s1.ptxt: Check oil filter and drain plug for oil leakage.
Start engine and run it for 3 minutes. Stop it and wait another 5 minutes before checking oil level. If necessary, add oil up to FULL level mark (hole) (1) on oil level gauge.
